xylanPnniMIB.name: xylanPnniMIB
xylanPnniMIB.contactinfo: Alcatel Internetworking, Inc. 26801 W. Agoura Road Calabasas, CA 91301 USA Phone: +1 818-878-3500
xylanPnniMIB.description: This MIB specifies additional Xylan functionality to the ATM Forum's PNNI MIB.

xPnniAssociativeNameTable.name: xPnniAssociativeNameTable
xPnniAssociativeNameTable.description: The xPnniAssociativeNameTable contains attributes that bind node names to PNNI Node IDs. There is a single row in this table for each PNNI node in the network. Default names are node1, node2, ... until the administrator specifically configures a different name.

xPnniNameEntry.name: xPnniNameEntry
xPnniNameEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a PNNI node in this network.

xPnniNodeIndex.name: xPnniNodeIndex
xPnniNodeIndex.description: The index into the associative name table. This index also corresponds to entries in the nodal map table.

xPnniNodeId.name: xPnniNodeId
xPnniNodeId.description: The value of the 22-byte node ID which a switching system uses to represent itself in the peer-group.

xPnniNodeName.name: xPnniNodeName
xPnniNodeName.description: The ASCII text string which represents this node. The default node name has the value NODE_n where n is 1..65535.

xPnniAddressFilterTable.name: xPnniAddressFilterTable
xPnniAddressFilterTable.description: The xPnniAddressFilterTable contains attributes that allow an administrator to configure address filters for security. Address filters are specified by the following: the LGN to which the filter applies; their direction (in, out or both); their addresses (src, dest or both specified as an nsap prefix from 2 to 152 bits); their call type (PTOP, PMP, or both); their service class (CBR, ABR or RtVBR); their metric constraints (CBR - metric is PCR threshold, ABR - the metric is Min CR, and RtVBR - the metric threshold is either PCR, SCR, or Max Burst); their metric threshold; their trap threshold; any exceptions (all/no addresses pass except...) and the corresponding exception prefix (from 2-152 bits); and start/stop Time Of Day values: There is a single row in this table for each PNNI filter in this switching system.

xPnniAddressFilterEntry.name: xPnniAddressFilterEntry
xPnniAddressFilterEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a filter in this switching system.

xPnniFiltIndex.name: xPnniFiltIndex
xPnniFiltIndex.description: The index into the PNNI Filter Table.

xPnniFiltNodeLevel.name: xPnniFiltNodeLevel
xPnniFiltNodeLevel.description: The level of the node within this switching system. Note that filters may be defined for any level. If a node at a specific level is disabled, then corresponding filters become inactive until the node is re-enabled.

xPnniFiltSrcPrefLen.name: xPnniFiltSrcPrefLen
xPnniFiltSrcPrefLen.description: The length (in bits) of the source prefix.

xPnniFiltSrcPrefix.name: xPnniFiltSrcPrefix
xPnniFiltSrcPrefix.description: The source prefix to be filtered.

xPnniFiltDestPrefLen.name: xPnniFiltDestPrefLen
xPnniFiltDestPrefLen.description: The length (in bits) of the destination prefix.

xPnniFiltDestPrefix.name: xPnniFiltDestPrefix
xPnniFiltDestPrefix.description: The destination prefix to be filtered.

xPnniFiltCallType.name: xPnniFiltCallType
xPnniFiltCallType.description: The call type indicates if the filter is to be applied to point to point calls, point to multi-point calls (add parties), or to both.

xPnniFiltCallSrvCls.name: xPnniFiltCallSrvCls
xPnniFiltCallSrvCls.description: The service class (if any) which this filter is active for. If the service class is CBR, then the xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt field below must be set to PCR. If the service class is ABR, then the xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt field below must be set to Min-CR. If the service class is RtVbr, then the xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt field below must be set to either PCR, SCR or Max-burst. Any of the three previous values for xPnniFiltCallSrvCls (CBR, ABR and RtVbr) should result in a non-zero xPnniFiltCallMtrcThresh below. Finally, if the service class is set to none-specified, then the fields xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt and xPnniFiltCallMtrcThresh are ignored.

xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt.name: xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt
xPnniFiltCallMtrcConstrnt.description: A metric constraint that is used with xPnniFiltCallSrvCls.

xPnniFiltCallMtrcThresh.name: xPnniFiltCallMtrcThresh
xPnniFiltCallMtrcThresh.description: A metric threshold value that is used with xPnniFiltCallSrvCls. The value 0 is only valid if the xPnniFiltCallSrvCls is none-specified.

xPnniFiltTrapThresh.name: xPnniFiltTrapThresh
xPnniFiltTrapThresh.description: A threshold which when this number of filter hits are encountered, will cause a trap to be sent to all trap-clients. The value of 0 causes traps to be inhibited.

xPnniFiltSrcExceptionCriteria.name: xPnniFiltSrcExceptionCriteria
xPnniFiltSrcExceptionCriteria.description: The criteria used to cause exceptions to the source address filters. If the value is none-specified, then the fields: xPnniFiltSrcExceptionLen and xPnniFiltSrcException are ignored. If this value is all-addrs-pass-except or no-addrs-pass-except, then the xPnniFiltSrcExceptionLen and xPnniFiltSrcException attributes contain the source prefix len and prefix which are to be exception handled. This value cannot be set to all-addrs-pass-except or no-addrs-pass-except if the xPnniFiltSrcPrefLen (above) is set to 0.

xPnniFiltSrcExceptionLen.name: xPnniFiltSrcExceptionLen
xPnniFiltSrcExceptionLen.description: The length (in bits) of the exception address prefix attribute: xPnniFiltSrcException.

xPnniFiltSrcException.name: xPnniFiltSrcException
xPnniFiltSrcException.description: The ATM Address Prefix of the source address exception.

xPnniFiltDestExceptionCriteria.name: xPnniFiltDestExceptionCriteria
xPnniFiltDestExceptionCriteria.description: The criteria used to cause exceptions to the destination address filters. If the value is none-specified, then the fields: xPnniFiltDestExceptionLen and xPnniFiltDestException are ignored. If this value is all-addrs-pass-except or no-addrs-pass-except, then the xPnniFiltDestExceptionLen and xPnniFiltDestException attributes contain the destination prefix len and prefix which are to be exception handled. This value cannot be set to all-addrs-pass-except or no-addrs-pass-except if the xPnniFiltDestPrefLen (above) is set to 0.

xPnniFiltDestExceptionLen.name: xPnniFiltDestExceptionLen
xPnniFiltDestExceptionLen.description: The length (in bits) of the exception address prefix attribute: xPnniFiltDestException.

xPnniFiltDestException.name: xPnniFiltDestException
xPnniFiltDestException.description: The ATM Address Prefix of the destination address exception.

xPnniFiltDeniedHitCount.name: xPnniFiltDeniedHitCount
xPnniFiltDeniedHitCount.description: A counter specifying how many times this filter was activated. Writing a 0 value to this field will cause this counter to be reset for this filter.

xPnniFiltExceptionHitCount.name: xPnniFiltExceptionHitCount
xPnniFiltExceptionHitCount.description: A counter specifying how many times this filter was activated but an exception was permitted. Writing a 0 value to this field will cause this counter to be reset for this filter.

xPnniFiltTODStartHr.name: xPnniFiltTODStartHr
xPnniFiltTODStartHr.description: The hour of the day (using a 24 hour clock) when the filter is to be activated.

xPnniFiltTODStartMin.name: xPnniFiltTODStartMin
xPnniFiltTODStartMin.description: The minute of the hour when the filter is to be activated.

xPnniFiltTODStartSec.name: xPnniFiltTODStartSec
xPnniFiltTODStartSec.description: The second of the minute when the filter is to be activated.

xPnniFiltTODStopHr.name: xPnniFiltTODStopHr
xPnniFiltTODStopHr.description: The hour of the day (using a 24 hour clock) when the filter is to be de-activated.

xPnniFiltTODStopMin.name: xPnniFiltTODStopMin
xPnniFiltTODStopMin.description: The minute of the hour when the filter is to be de-activated.

xPnniFiltTODStopSec.name: xPnniFiltTODStopSec
xPnniFiltTODStopSec.description: The second of the minute when the filter is to be de-activated.

xPnniNumIAdj.name: xPnniNumIAdj
xPnniNumIAdj.description: The number of adjacencies registered via ILMI in PNNIs lowest nodes adjacency table in this switching system.

xPnniIAdjTable.name: xPnniIAdjTable
xPnniIAdjTable.description: The xPnniIAdjTable stores records of adjacencies which ILMI has registered with the lowest level PNNI node in this network. There is a single row in this table for each adjacency which ILMI has registered.

xPnniIAdjEntry.name: xPnniIAdjEntry
xPnniIAdjEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a PNNI logical node in this switching system.

xPnniIAdjIndex.name: xPnniIAdjIndex
xPnniIAdjIndex.description: A value assigned to an ILMI client registered via ILMI in this switching system that uniquely identifies it in the PNNI ILMI adjacency table.

xPnniIAdjAtmAddress.name: xPnniIAdjAtmAddress
xPnniIAdjAtmAddress.description: This adjacency's ATM End System Address.

xPnniIAdjSlot.name: xPnniIAdjSlot
xPnniIAdjSlot.description: The slot in which this adjacency is physically connected to this switching system.

xPnniIAdjPort.name: xPnniIAdjPort
xPnniIAdjPort.description: The port in the slot which this adjacency is physically connected to this switching system.

xPnniIAdjInst.name: xPnniIAdjInst
xPnniIAdjInst.description: The instance identifier on the slot port pair which this adjacency is physically connected to this switching system. In the event that this is not a tunnel, this value will be zero.

xPnniIAdjCsmPPort.name: xPnniIAdjCsmPPort
xPnniIAdjCsmPPort.description: The unique port id which PNNI has bound to this physical slot, port, and instance tuple.

xPnniIAdjAdvertised.name: xPnniIAdjAdvertised
xPnniIAdjAdvertised.description: Indicates if this ILMI client is advertised by this switching system. Note that if this value is False, the summary address may be used by remote nodes to still reach this ILMI client if xPnniIAdjSummarized is set to True (below).

xPnniIAdjSummarized.name: xPnniIAdjSummarized
xPnniIAdjSummarized.description: Indicates if this ILMI client is summarized by this switching system. Note that if this value is True, other nodes in the peer group will route to this node's advertised port of 1. Calls terminating at end-systems attached to this node will then be vectored out the xPnniIAdjCsmPPort.

xPnniIAdjLearned.name: xPnniIAdjLearned
xPnniIAdjLearned.description: This field contains a timestamp of when ILMI registered this adjacency with PNNI.

xPnniRtstTable.name: xPnniRtstTable
xPnniRtstTable.description: The xPnniRtstTable is a single-row table which returns the results of a route test requested by a remote mgmt station. The route test parameters are specified in the INDEX.

xPnniRtstEntry.name: xPnniRtstEntry
xPnniRtstEntry.description: An entry in the route test table, containing information about a route lookup request.

xPnniRtstClass.name: xPnniRtstClass
xPnniRtstClass.description: The class the route request is to use.

xPnniRtstType.name: xPnniRtstType
xPnniRtstType.description: This index specifies the type of call which may be either point to point or point to multi-point.

xPnniRtstDest.name: xPnniRtstDest
xPnniRtstDest.description: The destination address. This may be specified by the user as an address prefix, but the SNMP manager must pad this out to 20 octets.

xPnniRtstError.name: xPnniRtstError
xPnniRtstError.description: Indicates if an error has occurred and if so, the nature of the error. If this is set to success, then no error occurred and the rest of the row contains useful information.

xPnniRtstFlags.name: xPnniRtstFlags
xPnniRtstFlags.description: If error is set to success, this flag indicates the nature of the route lookup confirmation. If this flag is set to dtlAdded, then the route request resulted in a DTL being allocated for this request. In this case, the xPnniRtstOutboundPort, xPnniRtstHopCount, xPnniRtstDTL, and xPnniRtstCurPointer contain useful information. (Also, after this information is conveyed back to the manager, the DTL entry is freed.) If this flag is set to direct, then the route request is informing the caller to proceed out a directly attached port. In this case, the xPnniRtstOutboundPort is valid and is either 1 (to indicate a match on this node's summary address) or is a reference to the PNNI advertised outbound port. If this flag is set to myself, then the route request is informing the caller that the test call to the node in this switching system (identified by xPnniNodeIndex) returned a successful match of myself as the destination. In this case, the xPnniRtstOutboundPort is valid and is set to 0 (which indicates a match on this node's own address). If this flag is set to directEreach, then the route request is informing the caller that the test call to the destination resulted in a direct indication. In this case, the xPnniRtstOutboundPort is valid and is set to the static route's PNNI advertised port ID. If the user also specified a VPI and E.164 address, then the xPnniRtstVPI and xPnniRtstE164 fields will also be present.

xPnniRtstOutboundPort.name: xPnniRtstOutboundPort
xPnniRtstOutboundPort.description: If error is set to success, this indicates the outbound port of the route lookup confirmation. If this is set to 0, then this indicates the call was placed to this switching system's xPnniNodeIndex. If this is set to 1, then this indicates the call was placed to a reachability which matched this node's summary address. In this event, the IAdj table would be consulted to determine the actual port (if any) where the destination resided. If set to any other value, it indicates the PNNI advertised port of the static route which caused this port to be returned.

xPnniRtstVPI.name: xPnniRtstVPI
xPnniRtstVPI.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to directEreach, then this indicates the vpi (if set by the user) used to route the call.

xPnniRtstE164.name: xPnniRtstE164
xPnniRtstE164.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to directEreach, then this indicates the E.164 address (if set by the user) used to route the call.

xPnniRtstE164len.name: xPnniRtstE164len
xPnniRtstE164len.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to directEreach, then this indicates the number of significant octets used in the above E.164 address.

xPnniRtstHopCount.name: xPnniRtstHopCount
xPnniRtstHopCount.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to dtlAdded, then this indicates the number of hops in the xPnniRtstDTL.

xPnniRtstDTL.name: xPnniRtstDTL
xPnniRtstDTL.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to dtlAdded, then this indicates the DTL generated by the route lookup function in the switching system. Note that this is a complete DTL meaning that the DTL IE header is also present. It has enough room for 50 entries (50 hops). Each entry has a 22-octet node-ID followed by a 4-octet PnniPortId. Entries therefore are 26 octets each and each entry is contiguous with its predecessor and successor. This DTL will not appear in the DTL table since it's freed after generating the reply to the management station.

xPnniRtstCurPointer.name: xPnniRtstCurPointer
xPnniRtstCurPointer.description: If error is set to success, and xPnniRtstFlags is set to dtlAdded, then this indicates the offset (in bytes) into xPnniRtstDTL of the curPtr.

xPnniTrcBufSiz.name: xPnniTrcBufSiz
xPnniTrcBufSiz.description: A value indicating the size of the trace capture buffer.

xPnniTrcBufTrigger.name: xPnniTrcBufTrigger
xPnniTrcBufTrigger.description: A value indicating action on buffer capacity reached.

xPnniTrcBufControl.name: xPnniTrcBufControl
xPnniTrcBufControl.description: A value indicating a control action on trace.

xPnniTrcNodeIndex.name: xPnniTrcNodeIndex
xPnniTrcNodeIndex.description: This variable indicates the node index within this switching system to be traced.

xPnniTrcTable.name: xPnniTrcTable
xPnniTrcTable.description: The xPnniITrcTable stores records of captured frames from both the AAL-SAP as well as signalled RCCs. There is a single row in this table for each adjacency which ILMI has registered.

xPnniTrcEntry.name: xPnniTrcEntry
xPnniTrcEntry.description: An entry in the analyzer table, containing information about a PNNI received by a node in this switching system.

xPnniTrcFrameIndex.name: xPnniTrcFrameIndex
xPnniTrcFrameIndex.description: An index selecting a particular frame.

xPnniTrcFrameFrag.name: xPnniTrcFrameFrag
xPnniTrcFrameFrag.description: A fragment within a captured frame.

xPnniTrcDirection.name: xPnniTrcDirection
xPnniTrcDirection.description: Indicates whether the frame was transmitted or received.

xPnniTrcSlot.name: xPnniTrcSlot
xPnniTrcSlot.description: Indicates the physical slot where the frame was transmitted or received.

xPnniTrcPort.name: xPnniTrcPort
xPnniTrcPort.description: Indicates the physical port where the frame was transmitted or received.

xPnniTrcCsmPPort.name: xPnniTrcCsmPPort
xPnniTrcCsmPPort.description: Indicates the advertised PNNI port ID where the frame was transmitted or received. This is used primarily for signaled RCCs.

xPnniTrcFrType.name: xPnniTrcFrType
xPnniTrcFrType.description: Indicates the type of frame as specified in the ATM-Forum PNNI V1.0 Specification, Section 5.14.4, Table 5-21.

xPnniTrcLearned.name: xPnniTrcLearned
xPnniTrcLearned.description: Indicates the timestamp of when the frame was either transmitted or received.

xPnniAliasTable.name: xPnniAliasTable
xPnniAliasTable.description: This table stores address (prefix) bindings for Display purposes.

xPnniAliasEntry.name: xPnniAliasEntry
xPnniAliasEntry.description: An entry in the alias table containing information about a binding between PNNI address, nodeId or address prefix and a text string. When referring to a nodeId, this is called a domain name.

xPnniAliasIndex.name: xPnniAliasIndex
xPnniAliasIndex.description: An index selecting a particular name-binding.

xPnniAliasName.name: xPnniAliasName
xPnniAliasName.description: The name to be bound to the prefix.

xPnniAliasPrefLen.name: xPnniAliasPrefLen
xPnniAliasPrefLen.description: An length (in bits) of the prefix binding. A Prefix length of 176 bits (22 Octets) implies a node ID. A length of 160 bits implies an ATM Address.

xPnniTrapPnPortId.name: xPnniTrapPnPortId
xPnniTrapPnPortId.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the port-related variable.

xPnniTrapRouteAddrAddress.name: xPnniTrapRouteAddrAddress
xPnniTrapRouteAddrAddress.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the address prefix-related variable.

xPnniTrapRouteAddrPrefixLength.name: xPnniTrapRouteAddrPrefixLength
xPnniTrapRouteAddrPrefixLength.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the address prefix length related variable.

xPnniTrapFiltIndex.name: xPnniTrapFiltIndex
xPnniTrapFiltIndex.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the filter index variable.

xPnniTrapNeighborId.name: xPnniTrapNeighborId
xPnniTrapNeighborId.description: On a Neighbor trap condition, this identifies the neighbor node Id-related variable.

xPnniTrapNodeId.name: xPnniTrapNodeId
xPnniTrapNodeId.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the local node ID variable which specifies the level and LGN or lowest level node.

xPnniTrapNodeDownReason.name: xPnniTrapNodeDownReason
xPnniTrapNodeDownReason.description: On a trap condition, this identifies the reason a node has gone down. A value of LocalUiAdmin specifies that a user on the MPM's Console or Modem Port has caused the action via a UI Shell:phalt command. A value of RemoteTelnet indicates that a user logged in remotely has caused the action via a UI Shell:phalt command. A value of Mgmt indicates that a remote SNMP management entity Has caused the action via a (re)configuration of the PNNI Node Table.

xPnniTrapNodeDownRemoteIPAddr.name: xPnniTrapNodeDownRemoteIPAddr
xPnniTrapNodeDownRemoteIPAddr.description: If the above variable: xPnniTrapNodeDownReason indicates a value of either RemoteTelnet or then this variable indicates the remote IP Address of the entity causing the action.
